When it's at its best it's got great chocolate, anise, and licorice notes that pair well with their savory pastries such as a rosemary shortbread and sesame absinthe cookie.  When it's not so great it gets bitter, woody, metallic, and musty.  The baristas at the Ferry Building are excellent, but they face a big challenge keeping up with volume and pace of the shop.  Sometimes things don't get as dialed in as they should, so the coffee doesn't always live up to its potential.

Environmentally the Ferry Building location is sparse.  There's very little seating, although a spot is almost always available since most patrons are passing through to other destinations. The clientele is around 1/3 tourists, 1/3 Ferry commuter regulars, and 1/3 coffee geeks.

If you're at the Ferry Building, I highly recommend checking this location out.  If you're looking for the best BB experience, you may be better off getting the weekend brunch at the Mint Plaza location, which suffers from fewer of the limitations the FB faces and has some fantastic grub to boot.

I would give the Ferry Building location a 3.5 star rating if I could.
author: Dan C.

description:
This place has a ton of reviews between the farmers market, and their hayes valley location, so there isn't really much more I can say that hasn't been said before.

Now, it's rare for me to review coffee seeing as I'm allergic to caffeine and decaf is for quiters. Which goes to say, I just don't drink coffee. But every other sunday, when we come to the farmers market, I covertly steal sips of this delicious coffee out of my Bf's cup. He's not always so happy about it.
author: Allyson S.

description: Favorite:  Caffé Mocha - w/ Michael Recchiuti chocolate  - memorable
author: michael p.

description: I just had to try Blue Bottle Coffee after hearing all the hype. So on a Saturday while perusing through the Farmer's Market, my hubby and I stopped at the Ferry Building location. I ordered a Mocha and was really looking forward to the fresh chocolate ganache and while I loved the lovely heart in the foam, I couldn't taste any chocolate in my mocha. And the coffee was a bit too strong for me - but in Blue Bottle's defense I'm normally a chai girl. My hubby ordered the New Orleans Coffee and it was too bitter for his taste. Maybe next time we'll try the affogato which is apparently made with ice cream (sounds yum!).
author: Komal P.

description: Love the concept and the marketing but I can't say that I dream about this coffee.  The coffee is definitely smooth but it doesn't have the pronounced coffee flavor and aroma I desire.
author: San N.

description: No straight dog drinks coffee but when ah' do, ah' choose Blue Bottle. It's delicious coffee. Get da damn iced coffee fo' some 'estra fun. 'S coo', bro. It gots'ta knock yo' socks off. Dis locashun be great cuz' ya' kin relax by de booze.
author: Yue T.

description: Great coffee! I MEAN GREEAAAAATTTTT COFFEE!! As you can tell I drink too much coffee and being lactose intolerant I can't put milk in my coffee so it needs to be really good coffee...  Yes I drink black coffee when there's no soy milk... or no good soy milk.  Luckily Blue Bottle has great soy milk to go with their great coffee!! Even drinking it black was GRREEAAATTTT!!! Highly recommend :-) I have yet to check out their original garage location in Hayes Valley.
author: becca w.

description: I think their coffee is good but it's not 'wait in one for 20 minutes' kinda good. I order a latte here, and although it's been good, I can't say it's been exceptional. I know they individually filter their coffee, but I haven't tried. I prefer Philz on that front. Less of a wIt and closer to home. But if there is not a long wait, I like to grab a coffee here.
author: Yelena K.

description: Yummy coffee to go at the Ferry building.  My favourite is the Bella Donovan!
author: Modern L.

description:
I have had postive coffee experiences with Blue Bottle in the  past but a 25 minute wait for 1 single mocha killed my desire.  It was watery and $4.50.  The baristas seemed unaffected by the huge line to order and huge line of people waiting.  I was not the only one who felt like they were being ripped off.
If you are reading this, Blue bottle management please fix this and I would love to pay an arm and leg for something as simple as coffee.
author: Rita W.

description: These guys really know their coffee. They know a shot of espresso was divine! They roast their own coffee beans! The smell the taste and the service! All 1st class coffee with a down to earth taste! Go fall in love!
author: Juan M.

description: The New Orleans Ice Coffee is a special treat. It is flavored with a unique blend of mild spices which is difficult to describe. Try it. It's delicious.
author: Mosey S.

description: Blue Bottle Coffee Co. is a great alternative to the usual bitter, generic, corporate coffee that seems to be served on every corner in San Francisco (I'm talking to you Starbucks and Peets). The drip coffee is very well done, and the coffee drinks are elegant (try the Gibraltar, which is not on the menu but available by request), and the overall vibe for Blue Bottle is fantastic. I regularly go to the Blue Bottle in the ferry building, and I also enjoy the other locations.
author: Brian M.

description: I became addicted to Blue Bottle! During my stay in SF, I literally had Blue Bottle everyday! I enjoyed their cafe latte, the New Orleans iced coffee and the cafe au lait. All delicious!
author: Jolene C.

description:
I just love blue bottle. Absolutely a must try if you like strong/bold coffee. 

If you stop by their kiosk for a summer day, New Orleans' Iced Coffee is great as well.  I usually don't drink iced coffee, but this is not watery, still flavorful and bold in iced style.
author: Yoko S.

description:
I've had a long-ass week of 3 finals in 6 days and I'm counting on a Blue Bottle latte first thing tmrw morning to get me through the next 3 days of paper-writing.

Their New Orleans Iced Coffee is one of the few places to get a cold brewed coffee, a 24 hr long process that creates coffee with 67% less acid.  Not as good as Philz's iced coffee (which isn't cold brewed), but really smooth and delicious.  It was one of the few things that made my bf crack a smile while he was studying for the Bar last summer.

They are only there on Saturday mornings to 2pm though!!!  This one time we went 5 min past 2pm and I had to practically beg the guy to sell me 2 cups of iced coffee.  But it was worth the loss of dignity -- it's that good.
author: Erica Y.

description:
I leave work on Tuesday afternoons and head down to the Embarcadero Farmer's Market, where Blue Bottle has a small and bustling coffee cart. It's well worth the stroll and there is a definite spring in my step on the way back to work. Delicious coffee, made right!

Order yourself a "Gibraltar" (as in the "strait of..."). It is a shot of delicious espresso with steamed milk served in a large shot glass. It's less milk than a cappuccino and more milk than a macchiato - perfection for $2.75!
author: Craig G.

description:
My boyfriend said this morning's latte from Blue Bottle at the FPFM was the best he's ever had. I don't know if I would go that far, but I think that's mostly because I'm not ready to declare a winner in that all-important category.
Even when you are standing in a 15-person line in the rain, walking uphill both ways on the way to your home without electricity or plumbing, and also listening to two of the most obnoxious middle aged women squawk at each other about their nieces, Lindsay Lohan, Bloomingdale's, and God knows what else, it's worth it. Creamy, delicious, fresh, not burned, pick-me-up coffee magic made with love. I can tell by the heart in the foam on the top.
author: Colleen M.

description:
As one who loves coffee, but has not made the mecca to Seattle, I see nothing better than blue bottle coffee.

It has become my little SF tradition to grab veggies for the week at the Embarcadero on Saturdays.  I start the process off with a fat free cappuccino from Blue Bottle, where I do wait a bit for the decadence, but it is not so bad when the boys making the coffee are as good to look at as the coffee is to drink.

The rest of the morning is always relaxing despite the crowds because I have some delicious foam and espresso to keep me company.
author: Becky T.

description: Best latte i have ever had! The milk was super creamy and blended with the espresso so nicely! all the barista's have excellent latte are as well!
author: Jordan R.

description: I'm sorry, I don't get it. I don't like this coffee. I've tried it twice now. There's a long line that okay, okay, does move quickly, but still . . . 3 p.m. on a weekday? Really?? It has to just be the hype . . . The space is also VERY awkward, as you have to stand behind the people adding milk/sweetener but in front of the line and wait for your drink order. And then you become one of the even more awkward people adding milk/sweetener from an extremely cramped, crowded space. There aren't many options either--fine, whatever, Clover brand is great and all, but Caffe Bianco on Sutter has almond milk. And Stevia. And amazing coffee. But, anyway, to Blue Bottle. Eh. I've had worse. I've definitely had better--Intelligentsia, Peerless, and Mr. Espresso, plus whatever they're brewing at Bianco. This isn't good coffee, VERY expensive ($2.50 for just a regular cup? I don't care if it's individual drip . . . I really can get better coffee for under $1), plus . . . I mean, your only option is to drink it at a crowded bar set-up with people jostling you, carry it as you walk, or take it outside. 3 for the coffee. 0 for the ambiance. A no for the price.
author: Marie L.

description:
#28 of 100 on 7x7's The Big Eat SF 2009: A Gibraltar at Blue Bottle Café
http://bit.ly/1VmqYA

#28 of 100 on 7x7's The Big Eat SF 2010: A Gibraltar at Blue Bottle Café
http://bit.ly/a1POhh

I don't drink coffee, but I think I *can* taste how good the coffee is here. Following the 7x7 list, the gibraltar was ordered - something like part cappuccino, part macchiato. I think it had more caffeine than a Red Bull. So if that's your cup of...err...coffee, than order it!
author: Reid Y.

description:
OK, the coffee is pretty darn good -- very smooth, creamy and just the perfect temperature.  

Why not 5 stars?  I stood in line for 25 minutes to get a cup of coffee.  I had to run to make sure my meter didn't expire!
author: L C.

description: WORTH THE WAIT.  well especially if it's your first time or you're a tourist at the Ferry building.  There's actually 3 lines.  1 outside. 2 inside. Hint there's another line on the side of the main Blue Bottle Coffee space.  After in the main line for more than 15 mins I went over to the side and there was only 5 people in line! So after I got my DELICIOUS coffee the same people I was standing behind still had a good 10 people in front of them! I also tried their Mocha which was sooooooooooo smooth and amazing.
author: Liza P.

description:
Looks can be deceiving...

The line looks really long, but I only had to wait about ten minutes and after I ordered, it was ready extremely fast! (this was at 10:45am)

When I'm too lazy to walk to Mint street, this is an excellent alternative!

The coffee is delicious, especially the mochas, which are made with recuitti chocolate!!
author: Elaine S.

description: ITS MORE THAN THE PRESENTATION.......... What a wonderful way to end a day of meetings in the City than with my FIRST ever cup of blue bottle coffee!  The wait alone while watching the barista make my personalized pour made it all the more memorable.  A little dash of cream into my earth friendly to-go cup as I  boarded the ferry back to Sausalito.....I then proceeded to savor the excellent adventure...sip, by sip as the water rolled on by.  Thank you BBC - till my next trip across the bay.
author: Sharron R.

description: Hells to the yeah, this coffee is so good it's like an orgasm in your mouth.  I wandered over here one evening after having an early dinner at Hog Island Oyster Company.  I had high expectations after reading all of the positive reviews on yelp and was not disappointed.  I tried the individually dripped coffee which turned out to be the best coffee I have ever had.  I usually prefer espresso but  the drip coffee here is just as rich and tasty.   Blue Bottle has really raised the bar.  I only wish we had something comparable in Nashvegas but sadly no such place exists.
author: Kristie P.

description: Blue Bottle coffee is definitely amongst the best coffee in the world, that's for sure, and though I'm not perhaps the world's largest coffee snob per se, I've had amazing coffee in places like Kona, Seattle, Portland and Prague--so I think this can rank with the big guys. The espresso, plain drip coffee and cappuccinos are quite sublime, and I think their waffles are AMAZING. Coffee and waffle=bliss. Only annoying factor about Blue Bottle is the line. And there's always a line. I appreciate that each coffee is made individually, even the drip, and that's why it's slower, but I dunno, maybe more staff? Reconfiguration of the line? Hmmm.
author: nomi s.

description: Coffee all tastes the same.  You just put a bunch of sugar in it.  Coffee these days should just be labeled a dessert item.  If you don't like the after taste of coffee try this one.
author: Fatty A.

description: Prob the most amazing Cap I have ever had, I used to live in Europe and spent many days hanging out in Cafe's but think this might be top bitch in my all time fav Cap's, I love Ritual too, so it is a toss up. now only if they would open one in inner sunset
author: dub g.

description:
I was getting impatient because of how popular this place was and the long lines, but it was well-worth my wait. On a cold SF morning, this is the best thing to have.

Drip coffee or the soy latte - I love it all!
author: Daphne L.

description: Hey, I love your cappucino's and tokyo iced coffee, but does it really take THAT long to make an 8 ounce cup of goodness? The long wait is as consistent as the libations are good, but PLEASE some of us have to get somewhere.
author: M E.

description: Very good coffee and the staff is friendly and accommodating. I would say that Ritual coffee slightly edges out Blue Bottle in my book though...
author: Megan S.

description: A very good coffee. The misses likes to get a cap, but a can't resist the hand-poured drip coffee. It makes me contemplate existence and why we're here.
author: Jon D.

description:
Wifey's review:

Blue Bottle Coffee is absolutely delicious!  Had a cup of their regular coffee today and it lived up to the hype.  Definitely a must try if you like strong, flavorful coffee.  They brew each cup (yes, even coffee) individually so you can taste the freshness immediately.  Plan on going back to try their lattes.  I really like the fact that they are not a franchise.  BBC booth is in front of the Ferry Building on Saturdays from 8am-2pm, or you can try their Hayes Valley location.
author: Mr. and Mrs. L.

description: Having lived in Manhattan, I'm not good at waiting in line for ages for my caffeine fix. But the coffee is insanely good and almost worth the wait.
author: Sarah B.

description: Attention those from Melbourne  Australia: this is the best coffee I have found since leaving Lygon street's familiar surrounds... Would give it 4.5 if it were there but I loved this so much I gave it a 5
author: Scott C.

description: Visiting SF for week and hit the much-hyped Blue Bottle each morning.  My suggestion is to stick with the individually brewed drip coffees which are complex, balanced and wonderful.  Their espresso......not so much.  They seem to pull really tiny incomplete shots here - maybe half an ounce each. That was a bummer but the drip coffees are magical here and kept me coming back.
author: n g.

description: I was eager to give this place a try after reading all the rave reviews and because I love coffee so much! The line was huge but it didn't bother me. It moved pretty quick. I ordered a latte and to be honest, I didn't find it better/worse than other places. I totally understand that they are all for being natural but they really should have splenda or something of the sort as an option. Some people use artificial sweeteners as a preference and some because of health reasons so it really should be made available. I just ended up sweetening mine with sugar. I honestly still prefer Pete's.
author: Diane M.

description: They have really good whole beans. The way they describe the coffees is so poetic, but so true! I got the Yirg because it was mild and had a cocoa/vanilla aftertaste.
author: Tin-Tin E.

description: The long line made us curious.  The hot chocolate was ok and my husband had a good latte.  Overall satisfied and nice presentation
author: Karie M.

description:
Oh helllllo my one true love! I wish I could replace the blood running through my veins with Blue Bottle Coffee.  And, have I mentioned my love of the Ferry Building before? Could life get any better? I think not!

Actually, it could: if I could actually afford to buy Blue Bottle as often as I would like, then life would be perfection.
author: Jackie D.

description: Hype.  Long line.  Ok coffee.  Not worth $2.75.  Kudos for using compostable paper goods though
author: Douglas S.

description: I love coffee, but I'm not a big fan of standing in long lines.  Blue Bottle has tons of fans, but at this location they are so efficient that things seem to move right along.  All the baristas here are not just efficient, they are actually friendly!  Need another reason for coming?  Bryan!  He is reason enough!
author: Michael F.

description: I had been hearing about Blue Bottle Coffee Co for about a year before I had the opportunity to taste what all the hype was about.  I was not disappointed.  It was all I had imagined it to be...and then some!  I had a soy latte and it was absolute perfection!  It tasted kind of like a burnt marshmallow somehow.  I enjoyed every last drop...and believe me, I licked that last drop clean =)  YUM!  I live in the south bay, but I make sure to get my blue bottle fix at least once a month and pay this coffee godsend a visit.
author: Emily H.

description: We just signed up for the french press monthly delivery.  So far so good.  The coffee's they picked have been great and are just as they described.  It is pricey, but well worth it.
author: Mike M.

description: The Belgian waffles are amazing! They make them to order...so always hot and fresh. Unfortunately, the waffle machine seems to be broken again. Last time that happened it took them months to get a new one, apparently had to get it direct from Belgium. Oh, and the coffee's pretty good too. New Orleans iced is nice on warm day.
author: RK L.

description: Great customer service, the barista didn't make a big deal for returning the iced coffee that I didn't like.  The latte that I got  instead was the best, so creamy, delicious, and I loved the leaf design.  I will come back again.  One star less because of the 20+ min wait..
author: Maricela G.

description: There's coffee that's fast, easy, and cheap (Starbucks), and then there's coffee that seems to warm your soul because it's flavorful and absolutely delicious.  You sip it slowly and savor every bit of liquid in your cup.  When it's over, you feel satisfied, and you're already beginning to look forward to the next week's farmer's market, because you'll finally get to come back to this little gem of a kiosk.  Upon arrival to the Ferry Building, this is my first stop.  It's well worth the wait.  Blue Bottle taught me what a top notch, real cup of coffee should taste like. It's places like these that make San Francisco the wonderful city that it will always be.
author: Jen P.

description: I had my first Blue Bottle latte here last Saturday.  It was great.  Also, the service was extremely friendly (with a smile) (lots of smiles), so I don't think the "no service" observation really flies.  I will say that 35 minutes (at least) (what with the standing in line and waiting after the order) was r-o-u-g-h first thing in the morning.  I also thought the latte could be a smidge hotter.  But all in all, a San Francisco experience (although this ex-New Yorker does not like standing in line) (for that long) (for anything) (including movies) (or shows) (at least not without a cocktail in hand).
author: Laurel B.

description: Much too long of wait, but it is well worth it. I prefer the Linden location but when you hitting up the market on Sat AM and you have a Harlot , -the club, not the noun- headache the soy cafe au lait is a fantastic fix.
author: Sarah B.

description:
On my last trip to SF, my husband casually mentioned he'd like to try a cup of Blue Bottle Coffee to see what all the talk is about. His conference was too far but my office building was two blocks away, close enough for ME to do the tasting on his behalf. Wow, coffee approved. 

Some folks may not like the smoothness of these concoctions, but that would not be me. I tried the latte ... ahem, a couple of times, and the iced coffee and both were crafted to perfection. I noticed the beans are very fresh, possibly roasted in the back room? I noticed that after each drink, baristas remove the remains of the foam and other flavors from the espresso machine.

I did not receive any attitude, just a delicious cup (or several) of coffee.  I also highly recommend the belgian waffle. It's fantastic!
author: Yulia G.

description: BEST Coffee in the city !! this ain't Starbucks where you get your drink in a split seconds so quit whinin'.
author: H A.

description: Blue bottle coffee is easily the best coffee I have ever had. The cappuccino I ordered was no bitter at all, yet still had that the taste of coffee that people love. I'm not a big fan of coffee, but this placed got me hooked. I recommend people who do not like coffee to try out this place.
author: Wesley C.

description: I've been satisified with Blue Bottle everywhere...the Hayes Valley kiosk, the tourist frosted Ferry Building stand and this jewel I just found. No more settling on Starbucks when I'm shopping downtown. Not to mention the baristas aren't too harsh on the eyes either. Makes the coffee that much better I suppose.
author: Jacinta H.

description: As a former barista hailing from seattle, I spent some serious time when I first moved to SF searching for the perfect place to get my coffee. Blue Bottle wins! I love the drip, I love the lattes and I love the beans.
author: Heather A.

description: Love it.  Best Iced Coffee I've ever had.  Steeped in rich coffee flavor, without a hint of that burnt or acidic taste u get at starbucks.  how do they do it?  well, supposedly they use a special "cold-brew" method for their iced coffee so it's not watered down by ice, and they never use coffee beans that have been roasted more than 24 hrs prior.  ok, i am a nerd, i know, but this is a must-taste for sure... the coffee actually tastes like coffee aroma.  and they use all organic ingredients.  if only they had this in LA...  i'd be even more addicted to coffee than i already am.
author: Grace C.

description: Coffee is stellar, wait is long, and the service, while with a smile, is inefficient and clueless.
author: Carla B.

description: Smooth full-flavor, rich-earthy tones comprable to roasted tobacco.  Drip is made by the individual cup, for ultimate freshness.  Fresh beans roasted that morning, for espresso or drip, $7.50 for 1/2 lb bag.  I can't wait to brew my own.  I have a new favorite bean.  Hopefully you will too.  They have carts on the South side (tucked-into the covered walkway behing the venders) & West side (out in the open) of the building.  http://www.bluebottlecoffee.net/
author: Ray I.

description: I came at the end of a Saturday's Farmer's Market.  There were two people in front of me.  The baristas made me a tasty soy mocha.  I got exceptional customer service and the best soy mocha I have tasted in San Francisco.
author: Tricky H.

description: For someone who doesn't really drink coffee (or like to stand in lines) I make an exception for Blue Bottle Coffee. I go to the one at the Tuesday Farmer's Market at the Ferry building.  Yes they are slow but good things come to those who wait. They are also very nice.
author: All About Town ..

description: My family loves their coffee beans, which they should at those prices.  Anyway, I think the service can kinda suck, especially cause the girls working the counter pay way more attention to the male customers.
author: brewgirl b.

description: Way overrated. The price isn't so bad or anything, but the waiting in line for 15 mins on a Tuesday at 10am part??? Yeah right.
author: Piper E.

description: It was love at first sip. And the romance between me and Blue Bottle has continued to grow since their website has FREE SHIPPING (!!!!) for beans. I ordered the Bella Donovan, which is a really warm, smooth blend. Sadly, I can't make as beautiful and tasty a latte at home.
author: Ali A.

description: I am hoping that this trend continues and keeps spreading blue bottle across the city and into my my hood in the mission!
author: A P.

description: Overrated. You have to stand in an alley with the other authentic post-metrosexuals who pay a fortune to live in what was once Hayes Valley. the people serving you there act like it's a priveledge for you to be receiving their coffee. there is some kids furniture in an alley to sit on. I give it two stars because the coffee was great, but come on. being hip for hips sake is so over.
author: Kenny G.

description: Mmmmm... After Saturday morning yoga, I hit up the farmers market at the Ferry Plaza whereI fuel up on some Blue Bottle iced coffee. Yeah, it's expensive. But it's this kind of thing that makes living in San Francisco so damn pleasant, and why California has turned me into such a bourgeois softy.
author: Sahra H.

description: I HATE COFFEE!!! I don't like the idea of drinking a hot beverage on a hot day.....So one day while my friends ordered their lattes I ordered the iced coffee (on some occasions I will order a blended or iced coffee drink and pretend its not coffee, but ice cream) to my surprise I was instantly hooked!!!! WOWZA its freakin worth paying 3.50 for a medium sized cup.  Only blue bottle iced coffee from now on
author: foo d.

description: Good for Blue Bottle bringing coffee back to an art form. This stuff is real coffee and its brewed in a very rough and honest way.  The baristas know what they are doing but at the Ferry building they are a little less than friendly-then again I wouldn't be friendly either with lines that don't stop and impatient people who don't understand why it takes more than 30 seconds for a coffee.  For me it is still the best way to round out the Ferry Building experience.
author: Vanessa W.

description:
I've only been once, and I should say that it was a Tuesday, not a Saturday. To cut to the chase: possibly the best cup of drip coffee I've ever been served.

I've been ordering beans from Blue Bottle by mail when I remember (they only ship on Mondays), and I forgot, so I went to the Tuesday farmer's market to get some beans.

They sell beans by the half pound here. If you buy a full pound, you get a free cup of coffee. So I wanted to buy two half pounds. Problem is, I brew coffee at home via french press, and by the time I got to Blue Bottle (around 1:00 p.m.), they had one half pound of their Yirg (good for french press) and nothing else but various espresso conconctions like Retrofit. After asking if I had, maybe, a moka pot (I don't), the woman did the only responsible thing and told me, no, none of these other coffees are what you're looking for. That is already respectable, but then she gave me the free cup of coffee anyhow. That's downright decent.

And the coffee was sublime. I've heard good things about their espresso drinks, and I intend to come back next week to try that too, but it is on the strength of just the drip coffee that I am giving this five stars. If they were here five days a week I would be here five days a week.
author: Z F.

description:
i ain't saying anything that ain't already been said...best coffee i've had in this town

folks are nice, helpful picking out a bag o'beans even if there is a line of customers behind me...cute too

try to get your espresso at one of their locations or bittersweet, other locations that carry BB haven't been as consistant
author: tanuki c.

description:
we love blue bottle every saturday morning. yum!
the people that work the kiosks are great even when it is freezing and they have to deal with the continuous stream of annoying tourists.

rose is our favorite! she coined our favorite drink the amer-au-lait!
author: oscar e.

description: Overrated? Probably. Great coffee? Certainly. If you're the kind of person who bristles at the thought of going to Starbucks for a Crappuccino, you'll probably love Blue Bottle. I would describe the coffee as strong and full of flavor, but not bitter like Peet's can often be. You'll find the Blue Bottle stand at the Ferry Building's Farmer's Market on Tuesdays as well when the wait is no long at all.
author: Craig V.

description:
Sat. morning - 9am

Paid my $12.50 for 1/2 lb. of beans and two small cups of coffee (it's a little steep but I like their coffeee).

Stepped aside and talked to my wife. After about five minutes I looked over at the guy  who's responsible for pouring the water into the cones. He was busy talking to a woman who was handing out flyers for a "really cool concert." I asked him why there was no coffee being produced. He replied "I didn't get the list from Derek." Derek was the guy standing less than 5 feet from him who took the order. So, it took five minutes for two guys who weren't terribly busy on a rainy morning to get the drip coffee going. I complained to them and they said nothing. Not even an apology. Shabby service.

 I'm a devotee of this company: I buy beans from their Emeryville plant and I tell all my friends about them.
author: Joe M.

description:
Awesome coffee but buyer beware: The caffeine content must be at least 3X the regular amount.  I noticed this when I began buying the beans and drinking it at home.  I couldn't figure out what was "wrong" with me when I became shakey and actually needed to come home from work one day, until a friend mentioned that this stuff packs a punch. I am a daily, long-term coffee drinker who is used to allot of caffeine so they really need to get this brew assayed and disclose the content because if it affected me this way I can't imagine what it would do to someone who is sensitive.
I now buy Canyon Coffee - located in Emerald Valley in Redwood City although I'll admit it is not quite as good
author: K O.

description: I wish I lived in San Francisco, just so I could go to the Farmer's Market every Saturday morning to drink a Blue Bottle Latte.  It is that good people!
author: Becca R.

description: new orleans iced coffee was what i got, and i liked it.  my wife got a cafe au lait, and enjoyed it.  good beans good coffee.
author: Nick S.

description: Love the coffee... am thinking about it on my way to work until I have it in my hand... it's fascinating. You should try. It's not just coffee, it's an experience.
author: Casandra E.

description: This place has really great coffee, they brew each cup individually. Every time i come to the ferry building i make sure to visit.
author: Janine D.

description: The cappuccino is absolutely amazing, it feels like I am back in Italy and totally loving it. Totally recommend to all coffee maniacs. The downside is long line and when I say long, it means that you have to wait at least 15-20 minutes. Otherwise, if you are not in rush, you must try it.
author: richard p.

description: I love Blue Bottle lattes.  They are my Saturday morning treat at the market.  But I have to say the last two times I've ordered them (from the same barista I must confess) my latte was luke-warm.  Fine, fine, fine.....you don't want to burn the milk or burn the coffee---but I didn't ask for an iced latte!  Please heat the milk just a bit more.  Room temp lattes suck.  Thanks!
author: Caren H.

description: Last time i had the brewed coffee and thought it was ok. Today I got a macchiato which was really that freaking good!
author: Mark C.

description: Good coffee but hated the wait (both to place my order and to get my coffee).  I purposefully eschewed my typical latte for a plain drip because I didn't want to bother waiting with the 4-6 people waiting in front of me.  I still had to wait a bit (not sure for what), but it's more convenient to come here instead of trekking inside to go to Peet's when you're meandering around the Farmer's Market
author: Melinda C.

description: Horray great service and great coffee.  Why do they only bring out their happy smiling employees for the farmer's market?  This is what blue bottle coffee co service should be like (see my other review).  Too bad it only happens during the farmer's market.  The coffee and new orleans iced coffee are so addictive they should be controlled substances
author: Michael D.

description: i love it! best latte ever! when its hot go for the new orleans iced coffee:)
author: simone t.

description: GREAT coffee. It's a nice break on Tuesdays & seriously the best coffee I've had in SF hands down. There can be a little wait depending on when you go but it's worth it if you have the time. You can also check out the farmer's market & get some goodies there while you are down there.
author: Abby W.

description: Try to get some of the Misty Valley coffee they recently released. Blueberries in the morning. Good lord it's good. My hands are trembling just thinking about it.
author: Big W.

description:
well-worth the price and long wait.  after reading all these reviews i wish i would have grabbed some beans to take home with me.  

next time i am in sf i will be at blue bottle every day.  best coffee i had my entire trip
author: ellen s.

description: great new orleans iced coffee.. just enough chicory.. and plenty of flavor.. too bad there's not one of these coffee places in my neighborhood.. i'd give up starbucks for this
author: Stan L.

description: Good, strong coffee. Get here early before the line gets too long.
author: John W.

description: Wow this place is unbelievable!  I have tried so many of their roasts now and love the Yirgacheffe especially!  Also any of their crazy coffee making contraptions are a must at least once!  When I was on a no drinking stint for a couple of months I went in and the barista told me one brew tasted kind of bourbon-y...  I tried it - loved it - and was up for like 2 days!!!  Awesome coffee - you will never go back to anything else!
author: Rachel H.

description: 3.5/5 stars. i was wondering when my streak of amazing coffee stops would run out. after staying in bend, or for a month and sipping on stumptown, strictly organic and back porch beans it has finally ended. i just had a drip coffee which was way too light bodied for my taste. i would say the touch of half and half was the highlight of this roast. i can't speak of the espresso drinks...but after drinking french press from every shop in oregon the drip here was not on the same level
author: Shane B.

description: I like being treated like trash, or at least I look like I do. This could be the only logical explanation for the behavior of one of the blue bottle coffee attendants Saturday morning. I arrived at 7:24am super stoked to check out the little blue bottle stand carrying all the big hype and was not just ignored, snubbed. I know it was early, and I get that it is likely she was out until 2am the night before, but that is no excuse to be rude to customers. I had a few questions about the coffee's that were bagged and you'd thought I was asking her to go harvest the beans herself. What a task, I am so sorry to have to ask you to share your knowledge with me. Perhaps I should already know the difference between an Ethiopian Yirgacheffee and a Mesa de los Santos, but I'm just not that hip. After about ten minutes of waiting I was finally asked what my drink order was. The coffee is good, but not worth the trouble, at least not at this stand.
author: Michelle K.

description: Arguably the best espresso I've ever tasted ... and it was sooo unexpected.  I'd had heard rumor of this place in the past, but wasn't aware that I had found it when I ordered a dopio ... needless to day, from the first whiff, I realized I'd hit the mother lode.  Now I'm anxious to return for "the best drip coffee" ... and I've always been a Peet's and Fonte kinda guy, but no more ...
author: Perry P.

description:
The plus side: sometimes great coffee. The down side: erratic quality, for starters. They choose the cup side at random, but the amount of coffee stays the same, so big cups are weak. The really big downside, though, is that the people working their have so many buds, all of whom go to a VIP line on the side. Once, the line there was as long as the regular line. 

I'm glad the people working there are having a good time, but they can't keep track of what they are doing. They don't know who has ordered, who hasn't, what they ordered, or who's waiting for what. The whole thing might work better on the honor system. Just set up the machinery and let people make their own. 

It's really, really not worth it to wait in line for a long time to watch the baristas chat with their friends, avoid eye contact, and then forget to finish up your weak cup of joe for a good five minutes. I get tired of asking them where my coffee is and where the milk is. I go poach whole milk from Peet's now, or did until I swore off the place. Super annoying, spotty quality. 

One star because I think the beans themselves are generally great. Reminds me of Bi-Rite ice cream or Tartine, where the product is excellent but the helpings of attitude are even more generous. With Blue Bottle, though, the product sometimes sucks.
author: Mike K.

description:
excellent coffee, definitely worth going to. one of the best coffee places i've ever been to.
this location is a little snobby, though, i'd rather go to the linden st. location. longer lines, but better attitude.
author: King L.

description: Decent coffee but I think it's more hype than anything else. People seemed so mesmerized by the individual filtered coffee that they seem to forget they're paying more for the display than anything else. $3.50 for a New Orleans style ice coffee that comes in child's size cup, though probably their best item, is a bit much. Does anyone know if they roast their beans on site?
author: Tim S.

description: This is my favorite coffee company right now.  Plain drip-coffee tastes super good.   Also delicious when brewed at home.
author: Tina S.

description: was very curious about what all the fuss was with Blue bottle, went to give it a try..There was a long line (tourists) waited 10 minutes for a capp...looked for some sweet and low or equal or splenda and the folks at BB said "we only have sugar". I don't get it, what about those that can't have sugar, what about customer service??? Coffee was nothing special...will go to Philz now, seems 4 people told me yesterday how good the coffee is...hmmmm bet they have sugar substitutes!
author: Honest in SF H.

description: I love love love Blue Bottle!  The coffee is great and the food is terrific.  Whenever I go I pick up a half pound so I can be caffeinated through the week ... it's definitely not the same, but it's good.
author: Amber T.

description: What can I say that hasn't been said 129 times?  Not much.  This is definitely great coffee though, and worth the wait.  The thing is, I get why each cup is made individually, but why oh why does each serving of milk have to be made individually?  Seriously, couldn't they steam a pot of milk just like they do at Peet's?  And yes, it's quite amazing that their baristas are actually slow too, it's not just the process, it's that they've somehow been hired from the land of very slow people.  LOVE the coffee though.
author: E C.

description: Went to this coffee stand on a random trip up to SF with a friend of mine almost a year ago. I couldn't help but admire the girl behind the little stand, with hands so encrusted in coffee I wondered how she ever got them clean. She poured one of the most amazing iced lattes I've had, and in a mass rarity I didn't want a bit of sugar. Unfortunately it's hard to get to and since my friend was leading I have No idea where this coffee stand is.
author: Maria P.

description: Great coffee, but man, you better not be in a hurry because it'll likely be 20 minutes from the time you get in line to having a cup in your hand. I've never waited so long for a cappuccino. I don't think the workers understand the concept of 'efficiency'. The guy would stop to add beans to the grinder, and then a few minutes later add a little more beans- you get the picture. Also, at the Farmers' Market they ran out of beans (!) although it looked like they had some bagged for sale. Again, great coffee, but then it's only coffee.
author: Charles S.

description: Best coffee in the...dare I say...world?  I have consumed a lot of coffee across the globe, and this stuff is really, really good.  Even worth waiting 20 mins for!
author: Karen H.

description: The drip coffee here is great, the iced coffee even better, but the 20 minute line on a Monday morning while the too cool for school staff chats about their band or their tiny dog, notsamuch. When it's not too busy,though i have to admit it's awesome.
author: Chris G.

description: Really good coffee. Can be a long wait even when there's only a couple of people waiting but I already know that in advance so can't really complain about it. My one criticism would be that once late in the day I got a cup & after it was made was told they were out of creamer - for me that makes coffee undrinkable.
author: Fidel M.

description: Great coffee! These guys really know how to display. The only issue that keeps me from giving them 5 stars is that I'm a regular at one of their customers in San Jose that uses their beans. They do a better job with Blue Bottle's espresso.
author: Coffee C.
